title: Part Time Veterinarian
description:
You will be responsible for preventative care, the diagnosis and treatment of minor illnesses/injuries, and the diagnosis and management of chronic medical conditions. Your job will also entail educating clients and developing strong client relationships. You will have 2-3 veterinary assistants or technicians to assist you with this throughout the day. We offer affordable pricing and transparency to our clients. Just like your family physician, you will work with neighboring veterinary practices for pets that require emergency care, hospitalization, imaging, dentistry, surgery, or end of life care. We simply make primary care easy so you can help the most pets.

We are currently looking for candidates to work in our Paramus, Green Brook and Union locations.

**Why you should work with PetWellClinic:**

· There is no on-call or after-hours care.

· You will get to focus on one pet at a time because there are no emergencies, ringing telephones, and hospitalized patients to divide your time between.

· Because there are no scheduled appointments, you will never feel rushed or like you are “running behind”.

· You will have plenty of staff to support you throughout the day.

· We strive to create a culture of openness, warmth, kindness, diversity, and compassion. Because of this, you will feel like you are working with your second family.

· We offer a competitive salary, bonus pay, 401K with matching, health insurance, CE stipend, VIN membership, and paid time off

**Responsibilities:**

You will be responsible for preventative care, the diagnosis and treatment of minor illnesses/injuries, and the diagnosis and management of chronic medical conditions. Your job will also entail educating clients and developing strong client relationships. You will have 2-3 veterinary assistants or technicians to assist you with this throughout the day.

We are currently looking for candidates to work in our Paramus location and Union. We will have a fourth location TBD that will be opening within the year.

**Why you should work with PetWellClinic:**

· Full-time employees will not work more than 45 hours per week.

· There is no on-call or after-hours care.

· You will get to focus on one pet at a time because there are no emergencies, ringing telephones, and hospitalized patients to divide your time between.

· Because there are no scheduled appointments, you will never feel rushed or like you are “running behind”.

· You will have plenty of staff to support you throughout the day. You will often be working as the only veterinarian in the practice.

· We strive to create a culture of openness, warmth, kindness, diversity, and compassion. Because of this, you will feel like you are working with your second family.

· We offer a competitive salary, bonus pay, 401K with matching, health insurance, CE stipend, VIN membership, and paid time off.

title: Director of Pest Control Services
description:
QBS seeks a self-organized and responsible professional for managing all aspects of the Pest Control business. Develops proposals, manages client expectation, manage staff, training and coaching of technicians, perform safety training, meets monthly KPI’s. Supervise projects, client visits, identifying appropriate chemicals to use, mixing, and applying chemical or manual solutions to get rid of pests. Identifies pest problem and appropriate solution, applies chemical or trap, and removes dead rodents.

**The position requires the following, non-negotiable characteristics:**

· Precision and accuracy in the performance of all duties.

· Direct, articulate and succinct communication style, both verbal and written.

· Mastery of organizational skills, including management of multiple tasks and deadlines.

· Analysis of issues with a methodical and efficient, yet thorough, approach.

· Self-motivation to be proactive in identifying problems and developing recommended solutions.

· Self-discipline to always conduct oneself with the utmost professionalism, integrity, reliability and accountability.

**Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):**

· Manage the division and profitability.

· Supervise technicians performing work in the prevention, control and elimination of insects, vermin and other pests from client buildings.

· Identify correct Spray chemical solutions, powders, and gases on or near surfaces of a building to eliminate pests.

· Train technicians in products, safety and operations.

· Identify invading pests, including rats, termites, snakes, wasps, ants, spiders, mosquitos, or bed bugs.

· Identify damage to property.

· Act as technician as necessary

· Study preliminary reports and diagrams of infested areas and determine treatment type required to eliminate and prevent recurrence of infestation.

· Measure area dimensions requiring treatment.

· Ensure appropriate protective gear and equipment during application is available and used.

* Report any inaccuracies and/or deviations immediately.

**Experience/Requirements:**

· Seven years of verifiable full-time experience as a supervisor or manager working in the category or categories 7a, 7f, 8; or

· Seven years of verifiable experience as a supervisor or manager working as a certified private applicator.

· Certified Commercial Pesticide Technician issued by the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (7A, 7F and 8). This certificate must be maintained for the duration of employment. (Required)

· Able to lift up 50 pounds

· Able to wear a respirator

· *Proficient in Microsoft word, excel and outlook*

· *Customer-service skills*

· *Detail oriented*

· OSHA training

· Recertification approved by NYS DEC when required

*Quality Building Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

title: High School Dean of Special Education
description:
**High School Dean of Special Education**

(2024 - 2025 School Year)

**Coney Island Preparatory Public Charter School**

*Brooklyn, New York*

**What is the Role?**

As the Dean of Special Education, you are an instructional leader who partners with teachers, instructional peers, families, the NYC DOE’s Committee on Special Education, and related service providers to ensure that our students with IEPs have access to their mandated programming. You will be responsible for leading the Special Education team at the High School to provide high quality, differentiated instruction to students with variable needs. Additionally, you will work with instructional leaders to ensure that classrooms are structured so that *all* students have access to rigorous, standards-aligned content.

**What You’ll Be Asked To Do**

**Operate with effectiveness** by ensuring that Special Education systems are in compliance with all relevant NYS and NYC regulations and guidelines.

* Manage identification process for students with classified or suspected disabilities in accordance with NYS and LEA regulations
* Work with school leadership and operations teams to ensure students are scheduled for all special education programming and accommodations in their IEPs
* Work with CSE, related service agencies, and para staffing agencies to secure and schedule mandated related services
* Work with CSE to schedule and facilitate annual, triannual, and initial IEP meetings
* Write IEPs and manage quarterly goal tracking in SESIS
* Coordinate with the CSE and the Operations team to support with door to door bussing
* Train and hold staff accountable for completing all required reporting for students with disabilities
* Serve as the main point of communication for families of students with IEPs on all issues related to identification, testing, meetings, and educational needs

**Deliver exceptional results** by ensuring that all classrooms are implementing best practices to support variable learners.

* Contribute as a member of the school’s academic leadership team
* Collaborate with instructional leaders to ensure that our instructional systems are planned to support variable learners during Tier 1 instruction
* Analyze data trends regularly in order to plan for responsive student interventions
* Coordinate Response to Intervention (RTI) team and facilitate meetings
* Create and and execute professional development for teachers on best practices for supporting variable learners
* Support the Multilingual Learner Coordinator in the identification and assessment of MLL students with disabilities
* Collaborate with the ENL (English as a New Language) teacher to support learning in all content areas
* Assist with proctoring the NYSITELL and NYSESLAT (assessment) and collecting HLQ forms (identification)

**Develop talent** by creating high quality professional learning for all teachers.

* Create targeted development for 4-5 Special Education teachers
* Coach and provide insightful feedback on strengths as well as opportunities for growth
* Lead content team meetings for Special Education teachers; participate in STEM, humanities, and world languages content team meetings as needed

**What You’ll Need**

* Passion for education and a dedication to Coney Island Prep’s mission, beliefs, and values and its commitment to anti-racism
* Steadfast belief that all scholars can achieve at the highest academic levels and deserve an opportunity to succeed in the college and career of their choice
* Proven organizational, oral, and written communication skills; timeliness; accuracy; and consistent and regular communication; and ability to meet deadlines
* Self-reflective and open to feedback, with the ambition and desire to grow and develop
* A positive, solutions-oriented attitude and drive for excellence
* Eagerness to work collaboratively as part of a team
* Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s preferred
* At least 3 years of experience teaching, coaching and developing IEPs

**Who are we?**

Coney Island Prep is a college preparatory public charter school in Brooklyn, New York. Merging growth, performance, and commitment, the Coney Island Prep community takes its responsibility to prepare scholars for the college and career of their choice very seriously, but not ourselves. We balance our sense of ownership and responsibility with humility and levity and support each other every step of the way. Coney Island Prep currently serves over 1,300 scholars across its four schools, including:

* 312 scholars in kindergarten – second grade at the lower elementary school
* 336 scholars in third – fifth grade at the upper elementary school
* 348 scholars in sixth – eighth grades at the middle school
* 349 scholars in ninth-twelfth grade at the high school

**Commitment to Anti-racism, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Justice**

Coney Island Prep is committed to building a team that collectively reflects the various backgrounds, experiences, and identities of our scholars. We recognize and respond to different points of access, so that everyone maximizes their highest potential. We also recognize that because of institutionalized racism and systemic oppression, historically marginalized groups are at a disadvantage when it comes to most application and hiring processes. We want to ensure that all candidates, regardless of their identity, are able to demonstrate their qualifications and are not limited by a lack of opportunity or access. We are committed to creating a space where everyone’s identity is acknowledged, respected, and welcomed. We are intentional about creating an environment where people feel comfortable being their authentic selves at work by constantly examining our organization culture and challenging our traditions.

**Benefits and Compensation**

* Employees at Coney Island Prep are provided with salaries that are highly competitive, set through a lens of equity, and based on an individual’s skills and experiences relevant to the role. The starting salary for this role is $90,000 to $95,000.
* As a regular full time employee of Coney Island Prep, you will be eligible for benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as a 403(b) retirement benefit package with match and Paid Family Leave.
* Staff are provided with a MacBook Air and access to all the necessary technology and resources needed to succeed in their role.

**Are you** ***“All In?”*** This position starts **immediately**. To apply, head to our !

*Coney Island Preparatory Public Charter School is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, national origin, citizenship or disability. We want Coney Island Prep to be a place where scholars and staff of all backgrounds, experiences, and identities feel as though they are valued and can excel.*

title: Property Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**  
We are seeking a dedicated Property Manager to oversee the daily operations of our residential community. The ideal candidate will ensure efficient property management, tenant satisfaction, and adherence to all relevant regulations.

**Duties:**  
· Maintains occupancy and rent collection targets;

· Posts rent payments for the site, including tenant payments, subsidy checks, and other payments;

· Monitor Accounts Receivable, and assist the property accountant in initiating collections activities, including legal action for non-payment.

· Provides periodic reports to management with respect to site-specific occupancy and tenant certifications.

· Assists in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual reports required by various programs or government entities, ensuring all deadlines are met.

· Creates and tracks invoices for third-party vendors and providers to ensure timely payment;

· Makes contact with and monitors vendor orders and confirms service delivery.

· Works cooperatively with the Maintenance Staff to insure the highest level of professionalism.

**Compliance:**

· Completes all application and certification paperwork for review by the Compliance Staff;

· Prepares residential leases and maintains program-compliant waitlists;

· Prepares for and participate in annual compliance audits by state and local agencies;

· Ensures timely and accurate tenant recertification in accordance with property-specific program requirements;

· Maintains compliance with EIV and other HUD compliance protocols;

· Works with Property teams to set goals to ensure all properties are kept to occupancy manual standards.

· Coordinates and assists with preparation in facility inspections, both internal and external;

· Coordinates and assists with apartment inspections as required.

**Required Skills and Qualification**

* Confident, positive attitude, and ability to multi-task.
* Knowledge of YARDI or similar property management software
* Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to interact with a wide range of people.
* Working knowledge of the NJHMFA and HUD regulations
* Proficient in Microsoft Office
* Accuracy and attention to detail
* 3+ years or property management experience, affordable housing preferred.
* Working knowledge of LIHTC or HUD guidelines
* Proven experience in property management or related field
* Strong customer service skills with the ability to interact professionally with tenants
* Knowledge of property leasing practices and procedures
* Ability to maintain organized files and documentation

title: Swim Instructor
description:
Swim Instructor

General Description:All swim instructors are expected to provide the highest level of instruction in the region. Instructors will be engaged, energetic, and knowledgeable. The job of the swim instructor is to instill a love of swimming in all of their students, while preparing them to progress through our system.

* Maintain professional appearance at all times
* Cheerful, enthusiastic, knowledgeable, helpful.
* Arrive and be prepared to teach classes 5-15 mins before class is ready to begin.
* Follow YWCA Swim Instruction guidelines & teach proper stroke/skill progressions(complete the training within a month of being hired if new)
* A passion for children and young families
* A passion for exceptional customer service
* Instruct assigned classes.
* Maintain communication with class participants and parents.
* Explain class and pool procedures to program participants.
* Evaluate swimming levels and prepare certificates.
* Attend all staff meetings and trainings.
* Mentor new staff members on proper behavior in teaching and on deck behavior
* Helpful to all members
* Able to add private swimming lessons for clients who need or request when classes are full or not offered at a desired time.
* Work on assigned office/admin projects
* Notify supervisor in advance of any schedule conflicts and find substitute instructor/guard as needed

**Certificates and Licenses**: Lifeguard, CPR/AED and First-Aid certification required. Shallow-water attendant highly recommended. In the case where either/all required certifications are not held, it is expected that each will be secured as part of the on-boarding and training process. A WSI is a plus.

**YWCA HISTORY AND KEY FACTS**

Around the globe, YWCA operates in 125 countries reaching 25 million women and girls through its work in 22,000 communities. It is the oldest and largest multicultural women’s organization in the world. In the United States, the YWCA, founded in 1855, has over 200 local associations that serve 2 million members. Since its beginning, the YWCA has been a major force in this country’s struggles for freedom, justice, and equality.

YWCA Greenwich’s mission is to eliminate racism, empower women, and promote peace, justice, freedom, and dignity for all. Through leadership, innovative programs, services, and educational opportunities, YWCA Greenwich is a driving force for a healthier, safer, and more equitable community.

Today, YWCA Greenwich offers over 100 age-specific programs, events and services in a facility that features a fully equipped fitness center, pool, gymnasium, childhood education center, dance and yoga studio, tennis courts, domestic abuse center, art gallery, café, water playground, Kompan structures playground, sand play area, meeting rooms and staff offices.

The key programmatic areas are: Domestic Abuse Services, Aquatics, Childhood Education programs, Fitness memberships, Health & Recreation Programs, and the Center for Equity and Justice. More specifically:

YWCA Greenwich provides comprehensive direct services to victims of domestic violence through 24-hour hotlines, crisis intervention, counseling, court advocacy, and emergency sheltering. Recently we have added a Civil Legal Clinic and Financial Literacy Coaching to our array of free services to victims of domestic violence. In addition, the YWCA Greenwich provides prevention education through extensive training of key members of the community and age-appropriate domestic abuse prevention programs through the Greenwich Public Schools.

YWCA Greenwich has a nationally recognized swim team. The Dolphins, now in its 50th season with well over 200 swimmers, can point with pride to their fourth consecutive USA Swimming recognition as a “Silver Medal” Club, placing the team in the top 4% nationally.

YWCA Greenwich boasts a diverse top-rated international preschool center, with children from a variety of racial, ethnic, and economic backgrounds representing not only the United States but also 25 other countries around the world.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**

YWCA Greenwich commits to provide equal employment to all qualified persons solely on the basis of job-related skills, ability, and merit, without regard to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, genetics, physical or mental disability or handicap, or any other protected class status. YWCA Greenwich will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would result in an undue hardship, and provide a workplace free from sexual harassment, discrimination, and retaliation.

Black, Indigenous, Latinx, AAPI and LGBQ+ persons are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: Business Development Representative
description:
**FoodPrep Solutions**, has an exciting opportunity for a Business Development Representative based in **New York, NY**. FoodPrep Solutions (FPS) provides sharpening services, food equipment sales and service, and related merchandise to the foodservice industry. Our customers include many of the businesses where you dine and shop including restaurants, supermarkets, gourmet markets, and deli’s.

As the fastest growing company in the industry, FoodPrep is seeking energetic self-starters who want to be part of a dynamic team. As a Business Development Representative, you receive thorough training from our FPS Get-Started program, which includes a combination of learning our unmatched product offerings, proprietary selling techniques, and 1:1 coaching from experienced management. FoodPrep will ensure you are ready for success and able to take advantage of our aggressive commission structure.

We want people who are motivated, personable and aggressive. Former Cooks, Chefs, and kitchen staff encouraged to apply! We will provide you with the tools, a competitive base salary, and an exciting commission potential to be highly successful. Are you ready for the journey?

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

Your role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you close the deal. You will also ensure proper after-sales service.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

***Soliciting and Making Sales***

* Executing in-person 15 sales contacts each day.
* Establishing a minimum sales quota of new customers each week through cold calling, networking, and prospecting of existing company leads.
* In conjunction with obtaining new sharpening services customers, you will have the ability to sell additional products and services. FoodPrep has the widest array of offerings in the industry, which provides our BDR’s with the greatest upside earning potential.
* Working effectively with FoodPrep service and support team members.

***Tools for Effective Selling***

* Ensuring your vehicle is outfitted with inventory or perfect knives and ancillary products.
* Operating your vehicle in a safe and lawful manner.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Relationship management skills and openness to feedback.

**REQUIRED AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* **Minimum Education:** Bachelor’s degree (preferred)
* **Required Experience:** Sales experience preferably in the food service industry.
* **Required Skills:** Driver’s License
* **Preferred:** Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office
* Flexible scheduling (potential for remote work)

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified. FPS retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.***FPS is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, pregnancy, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, service in the uniformed services, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.***

title: Associate Attorney
description:
**Job** **Title**: Associate Attorney

**Salary**: $150,000 - $180,000

**Location**: Manhattan (NY) or Woodbridge Township (NJ)

Simpson Judge Ltd are currently partnered with a top 20 globally recognized Law Firm, that are specialists within Real Estate Law, to assist with their litigation department growth plans. Being present across 16 states, with over 400 attorneys within the firm, our client is currently looking for confident & results-driven litigators.

This position can be based out of either their NY or NJ offices. You will be representing mortgage servicer and investor clients in foreclosure, title and general real estate litigation, including consumer claims directly against the firm’s clients.

This position includes, but is not limited to, making appearances in state and federal court for routine and contested hearings, reviewing incoming litigation and developing case strategy, drafting documents, conducting discovery and settlement negotiations.

**What they need:** 

- J.D. Degree, with admission to practice law in New York or New Jersey required, both preferred.

- Minimum 2-4 years of litigation experience

- Knowledge of NY/NJ Mortgage Foreclosure law & practice

**What’s on offer:** 

- Opportunity to work alongside their highly regarded and experienced litigation Partners

- Hybrid & welcoming working environment

- Competitive salary / benefits and bonus structure

- Opportunity to acquire additional admissions (NY/NJ)

**What you’ll be doing:** 

- Manage and handle case load of contested foreclosures, defensive litigation and ancillary matters on behalf of mortgage servicers and investors.

- Analyze loan files, title reports, and other client documents.

- Draft motions, pleadings, settlement agreements, discovery demands and responses.

- Appear in court for settlement and case management conferences, and to argue motions.

- Communicate with clients to insure quality representation and implementation of all client directives, including electronic communication through various online portals used by clients.

- Collaborate with support staff for preparation and execution of documents to be signed by the client, filed with the court and/or for internal or client reporting purposes.

- Research and analyze difficult client cases and collaborate with partners as to client advice and potential resolution.

- Create matter budgets and seek fee approval from clients as per their requirements; track billable and non-billable time.

If this opportunity sounds like it could be of potential interest, please apply to this job advertisement with an updated resume, for consideration.

title: Manager, Quality Operations (Hybrid)
description:
Bracco Diagnostics Inc. is a subsidiary of Bracco Imaging which is part of the overall Bracco Group. The Company specializes in the clinical development, marketing and sales of diagnostic contrast imaging agents. Bracco Diagnostics Inc. primarily markets its products to hospitals throughout the United States. Bracco Diagnostics Inc. is committed to the discovery, development, manufacturing and marketing of imaging agents and solutions aimed at providing a better use and management in terms of diagnostic efficacy, patient safety and cost effectiveness.
  
  

Manager, Quality Operations (Hybrid)
  
We are seeking a meticulous and experienced Quality Operations Manager to join our dynamic team. As the Quality Operations Manager, you will provide oversight to Contract Manufacturing sites and and manage our quality processes, ensuring that the highest standards of quality are met and compliance with regulatory requirements is maintained. This role is hybrid and will work out of our Monroe, NJ office 3 days per week. The ideal candidate will have experience in the pharmaceutical industry.
  
Main Responsibilities, Activities, Duties and Tasks
  
* Under supervision of the Associate Director of Quality Operations, the incumbent assesses quality and compliance events (deviations, change controls, CAPAs, etc.).
* Ability to author, evaluate, and review deviation/nonconformance investigations while applying quality risk management principles. Work with internal stakeholders and contract manufacturing organization(s) (CMO) to investigate and determine assignable root cause.
* Perform site visits with applicable CMOs as necessary to stay abreast with current CMO processes, personnel, initiatives, and to ensure compliance with BDI requirements and regulatory filings.
* Serve as the BDI QA direct point of contact at assigned CMO(s) for information exchange between BDI and the CMO(s).
* Identify corrective and preventive action in support of investigation and audits; routinely follow up on corrective and preventive actions and effectiveness checks ensuring adequate and timely closure.
* Review, evaluate, and document Change Control requests, ensuring compliance with cGMP and quality standard requirements. Follow-up on recommended actions, change implementation, and change closure. Support change control with stakeholders and CMOs to closure. When applicable, generate BDI change control(s) with capacity to identify change implementation tasks and partner with stakeholders to ensure compliant change implementation.
* Support the BDI batch release process through review of batch documentation and compliance with BDI procedures. Perform periodic full CMO batch record review.
* Write and review procedures/processes relating to Quality Operations.
* Prepare and present quality reports, data, and metrics of Key Performance Indicators to management for review.
* Support and/or lead Group Quality projects. Serves as Quality Operations representative on company initiatives.
* Review CMO Annual Product Reviews and generate summary assessments for the applicable reporting period.
* Review and monitor trends, communicating out-of-trend issues to management.
* Assist in ensuring departmental understanding and compliance with cGMP as applied to the company's products and processes. Provides quality & compliance guidance to internal stakeholders and suppliers.
* As needed, participate in the development, and maintenance of quality agreements with suppliers and the Company's Quality System to meet the requirements of applicable quality and regulatory standards.
* Support other departmental activities as requested by department management or designee.
* Prepare and act as coordinator for Semi-Annual Quality Review meeting with CMOs. Provide quality and compliance oversight to CMOs.
* Support internal / external audit program and/or other audits (i.e. FDA) as a Quality Operations representative as needed.


Education
  
* Bachelors/Undergraduate Degree in quality or science discipline.
* Advanced degree/certifications desired.
* Minimum of six (6) years progressively responsible experience in pharmaceutical drug manufacturing or biologics industry in a direct Quality Assurance or Quality Engineering position.


Professional Experience, Knowledge & Technical Skills
  
* Demonstrated knowledge of Quality Management Systems.
* Knowledge of 21CFR210 / 211 and ICH requirements.
* Familiarity with pharmaceutical manufacturing, technical services, and / or qualification preferred.
* Demonstrated advanced computer skills (i.e. Microsoft Office, statistical software, TrackWise, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
* Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills, including the ability to conduct verbal presentations appropriate to the level of the audience.
* Demonstrated success working in a team environment. Able to establish key business relationship throughout the organization to enable compliance.
* Direct experience with statistical techniques and associated software desired.
* Lean Six Sigma experience desired.
* Experience with internal and external audit processes desired.


Soft Skills – Company Values & Behaviors
  
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment.
* Positive, energetic team player and an advocate for product excellence and quality.


Physical Demands
  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
Ability to travel by car and/or plane, up to 15- 20%. Additional travel may be required based on business need.
  
  

Work Environment
  
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The position is office based.
  
  

Bracco Diagnostics Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.

title: After School Group Leader - The Village of Pleasantville (Panther Club)
description:
**Panther Club After-School Group Leader**

The Village of Pleasantville’s Parks & Recreation Department is seeking eligible candidates for their 2024-2025 Panther Club After School Program.

Get paid to PLAY! Panther Club is an after-school program that operates during the school year, **Monday-Friday from 2:30pm-6:00pm.** Staff is expected to supervise a specific elementary grade level of children during games, outdoor play, and homework periods. The ideal candidate will have high-energy, take initiative, and have experience supervising or interacting with children in a day care, camp, after-school, classroom, or similar setting. Additional staff requirements and position duties include:

* Acquiring and maintaining CPR, AED and First Aid certifications and OCFS and NYS mandated trainings (The Village of Pleasantville supports staff in these efforts).
* Fully understanding and respecting OCFS and Village of Pleasantville guidelines for safety and compliance including maintaining 1:10 staff-to-child ratio, keeping attendance and daily occurrence records, maintaining program quality and control at all times, communicating effectively and efficiently with the administrative staff, etc.
* Developing and implementing activities for the program to keep participants moving, enthusiastic, and engaged.
* Be a community ambassador by taking initiative, speaking with parents, facilitating sign-in and sign-out procedures and maintaining a safe space for participants at all times.
* Candidates must be reliable, responsible, and capable of teamwork and collaboration to ensure overall program quality and consistency.

MINIMUM ACCEPTABLE TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE: Graduation from high school or possession of a high school equivalency diploma and three (3) years of experience in which the primary function of the position was conducting recreation activities, programs or services.

SUBSTITUTION 1: Satisfactory completion of 30 credits towards a Bachelor’s Degree\\* in Recreation, Parks Resources, Leisure Services, Physical Education or a related field may be substituted on a year for year basis for the above work experience.

SUBSTITUTION 2: Possession of current Certified Park and Recreation Professional (CPRP) status conferred by the National Recreation and Park Association or one of its authorized and recognized affiliates may be substituted for the above work experience.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
**Job Description**  
The warehouse manager should possess a managerial mindset, operational creativity, strong organizational skills, can read emails and effectively communicate with coworkers, process material requests via email, accurately count material, pull material from shelving, and load trucks.  
The individual we hire will have the ability to come in early, stay late, and work weekends as needed.

**The warehouse manager will be responsible for overseeing 4 departments in our warehouse**.

* Shipping
* Receiving
* RMA (Return Merchandise Authorization)
* Inventory

**Within these departments, the warehouse manager will be responsible for:**

* Ensuring products are delivered in the timeframe requested by our job site
* Managing warehouse associates, monitoring work, and confirming the safe use of warehouse equipment.
* Improving upon the existing practices to achieve optimal efficiency
* Setting team goals
* Auditing inventory to make certain our databases accurately reflect the material on hand
* Create cohesion between all departments and make sure lines of communication are always open

**Applicants applying for this entry-level position must meet the following criteria:**

* 18+ years old
* High School Diploma / GED
* Reliable Transportation
* Ability to use a computer and learn our company's databases to track inventory
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel
* Ability to email and correspond with jobsite management

**Physical Abilities**

title: Program Director, Pipeline Angels
description:
\\*\\*\\*\\*Interested applicants must first complete our job application for consideration.>>>https://ifel.jotform.com/242064515611145\\*\\*\\*\\*

The Institute for Entrepreneurial Leadership (IFEL), founded in 2002, is an independent, 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that seeks to build a more inclusive entrepreneurial ecosystem. Our mission is to eradicate the systemic barriers that prevent people from historically excluded populations from accessing the knowledge, networks, and capital required for entrepreneurial success and wealth creation. We work with corporate, institutional, higher education, and community partners to develop and implement innovative, inclusive, high-touch programming that promotes inclusion within the entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Our impact measurement centers on creating connections, changing mindsets, and inspiring action. IFEL serves nearly 2,800 small business owners, entrepreneurs, and founders annually through support from a community of over 1,400 business professionals and domain experts. Learn more about IFEL at www.weareifel.org.

**Performance Expectations**

A culture of accountability, integrity, and teamwork is the best combination to deliver exceptional results that drive impact. Toward this end, we center our performance expectations around three key areas: maintaining a positive attitude, demonstrating a professional demeanor, and consistently delivering on time with excellence. We value individuals who approach their work with enthusiasm, professionalism, and a can-do attitude, as this engenders trust and confidence in clients and teammates. It is essential that all team members prioritize completing their deliverables on time, as this ensures we meet our stakeholders’ expectations and internal accountability expectations. By upholding these performance expectations, we can collectively create a collaborative and supportive environment that drives outstanding performance.

**Position Objective**

The Institute for Entrepreneurial Leadership is a team-based supportive environment in which all employees actively promote the vision and advance the organization's development.

The Pipeline Angels Director is responsible for developing and executing the Pipeline Angels program, including recruitment, participant training and engagement, surveying, and metric tracking.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

This position will require your energy and creativity every day to serve our audience with the passion and dedication that is the IFEL Way. In this position, you will be responsible for the following:

* Organize and execute all Pipeline Angels programming, including:
* Plan and implement participant recruitment activities to build awareness and achieve participation goals
* Identify, secure, and host session speakers to participate in Bootcamp sessions, panel discussions, Office Hours, in-person events, and other investor training initiatives
* Liaise on all logistical matters with Pitch Summit founders
* Manage, train and direct activities of Pipeline Angels Facilitators
* Collaborate with Cohort Facilitator(s) to develop/refine training materials and ensure “as-scheduled” delivery of all investor training
* Develop and execute cohort schedule
* Create and refine awareness-building and recruiting materials for the program
* Plan and implement community building and engagement activities, including in-person events, virtual mixers, and posts on the Mighty Networks platform
* Manage all program communications, (e.g., outlining program processes for members and founders, answering participant questions, and recruitment outreach/follow-up)
* Create and distribute a Pipeline Angels newsletter at least 6x per year.

In addition to Pipeline Angels programming, you would have the following additional responsibilities:

* Support all IFEL programming that requires investor activation, including WOCCON Virtual Summit, Creating Conscious Collisions Road Show, and Capital Catalyst Initiative
* Support founder recruitment for IFEL events including Pitch Summits, Showcases, Annual WOCCON Summit, and Creating Conscious Collisions tour events
* Collaborate on cross-platform events and initiatives toward the goal of increasing the number of check writers from historically excluded populations
* Create and/or maintain the systems and processes necessary for the efficient execution of all Pipeline Angels activities, including: (1) ensure timely completion of all required reporting; (2) disseminate and analyze surveys to assess impact and participant satisfaction; and (3) create and maintain participant contact records

**Education and Skills Required**

We are looking for candidates who are driven by purpose, enthusiastic about the work, and have strong skills. For this position, we are seeking candidates with a bachelor’s degree and 5+ years of experience directing non-profit programs and/or working within the startup ecosystem.

The Program Director’s judgment, tact, and diplomacy are integral to success as the position may require knowledge of highly confidential and sensitive information. The person in this position must be able to work independently and deliver on time in a fast-paced environment that is constantly changing. The right person for this position will be able to set priorities, resolve problems, and complete projects on time, and will be a detail-oriented problem solver with a “can-do” attitude when faced with challenges. Strong candidates will have a “buck stops with me” accountability-driven mentality and will ask good questions to guide decision-making as needed.

In addition to these general requirements and expectations, we expect strong candidates for this position to possess the following skills:

* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple work streams effectively and prioritize tasks to ensure timely completion of all projects with minimal supervision
* Proven ability to drive team productivity and accountability
* Self-starter, able to independently identify what needs to be done, propose solutions, and execute
* Ability to meet deadlines and address programming issues as they arise
* Proven ability to drive team productivity and accountability
* Ability to thoroughly measure, evaluate, and present impact and other managerial information
* Ability to engage and present to executives, investors, and business owners
* Comfort with public speaking and leading others in discussion
* Proficient in Google Suite
* Aptitude for learning new computer and web-based applications quickly
* Excellent oral and written communication skills and attention to detail
* Working knowledge of social media, including LinkedIn and Facebook preferred
* Prior community-building experience is a plus
* Bi-lingual English/Spanish is a plus

**What we offer**

The work we do at the Institute for Entrepreneurial Leadership requires a lot of intellectual and emotional investment from our team members daily, in addition to keeping up with the fast pace of our deliverables schedule. Recognizing this, it is important to provide opportunities for rest, growth, and development for the individuals who make the IFEL magic happen.

* Time off - Our full-time team members get 28 days of paid time off per year, including ten (10) company holidays + 5 sick days as soon as you start, and ten (10) vacation days with increases based on longevity + 3 floating holidays after completing the 90-day introductory period. This time off will give you time to take care of your health, care for others, and recharge your spirit as needed.
* Medical Benefits - a variety of group healthcare and other wellness benefits.
* Feedback - The only way to get better is through a cycle of continuous review, reflection, and change implementation. We regularly provide team members with feedback designed to promote improvement so that you can be the best professional you can be and we can deliver the best service possible to our clients.
* Professional Development - The IFEL Leadership Team is committed to your success and helping you reach your full potential. While all team members come to the table with valued skills, there is always room to develop new skills. Each team member is expected to seek opportunities to improve core competencies and learn new skills related to your position.
* Building Community - Because IFEL’s success is rooted in relationship connectivity, we strongly encourage our team members to engage in IFEL programming. This will help you feel connected to the IFEL mission and experience the impact of our work firsthand.

title: Manager, HR Advisory
description:
Job description
Our purpose – Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. Here at HSBC we use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.


Do you want to be a part of a Human Resources team that is building the HR function of the future? HBSC Bank is looking for an HR Advisory Manager to support the Global Banking and Markets (GBM) line of business.


As our Manager, HR Advisory you will:


* Support people managers and employees in navigating complex people challenges across the spectrum of HR Services
* Build trusted-advisor relationships with Senior Executives and Global Banking and Markets (GBM) managers and delivering outstanding customer service while providing coaching and advice to help solve problems

For this role, HSBC targets a pay range between $87,900.00 and $131,800.00


The final fixed pay offer will depend on the candidate and a number of variables, including but not limited to, role responsibilities, skill set, depth of experience and education, licensing/certification requirements, internal relativity, and specific work location.


At HSBC, our overall goal is to provide a competitive Total Reward Package, with an appropriate mix of fixed pay, and variable pay, as part of an employee’s overall total compensation and benefits. Variable pay generally takes the form of discretionary, annual awards (sometimes referred to as a “bonus”). Additionally, HSBC offers a wide range of competitive and flexible benefits designed to help you improve your health and well-being, finances, and lifestyle.


Requirements
You´ll likely have the following qualifications to succeed in this role:


* You have a thorough knowledge and understanding of relevant HR legislation and policies as well as the business environment to ensure guidance aligns with business aims and goals
* You’re a collaborative teammate, but also a proactive, self-starter who is able to work independently
* You have a keen eye for detail, quickly able to identify errors or gaps in information
* You are comfortable interacting with and providing guidance to all levels of employees

In compliance with applicable laws, HSBC is committed to employing only those who are authorized to work in the U.S. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. as HSBC will not engage in immigration sponsorship for this position.


As an HSBC employee, you will have access to tailored professional development opportunities to ensure you have the right skills for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive pay and benefits package including a robust Wellness Hub, all in a welcoming, diverse and inclusive work environment. You will be empowered to drive HSBC’s engagement with the communities we serve through an industry-leading volunteerism policy, a generous matching gift program, and a comprehensive program of immersive Sustainability and Climate Change Initiatives. You’ll want to join our Employee Resource Groups as they play a central part in life at HSBC, including the development of our employees and networking inside and outside of HSBC. We value difference. We succeed together. We take responsibility. We get it done. And we want you to help us build the bank of the future!


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, race, national origin, ethnicity, disability or medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran service, religion, creed, sex, gender, pregnancy, childbirth, caregiver status, marital status, citizenship or immigration status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or any other trait protected by applicable law.

title: Electro-Mechanical Assembler - Boonton, NJ
description:
**Date:** Aug 8, 2024


**Location:** Boonton, NJ, US, 07005


**Company:** Hubbell Incorporated


**Job Overview**
----------------



Responsible for complex and diversified assembly of a variety of products in which mechanical drawings or work instructions are provided. Intricate fitting, adjusting, and aligning of a considerable number of parts (involving close tolerances and interrelated factors) are required to complete products, units, or sub-assemblies. Hand tools and usage of machines will be required to perform the assembly. Follows schedule provided by SAP and management.
**A Day In The Life**
---------------------


* Assembles and/or wires complex equipment following blueprints, models, and model prints. Skilled adjusting, fitting, and aligning are required within close tolerances.
* Follows work cell procedures or mechanical drawings and product structures.
* Sets up, operates, and maintains basic production machines such as component engravers, presses, crimpers, riveting or encapsulation machines.
* Is flexible and able to perform many operations on product in and outside of home department.
* Uses hand and power tools as required.
* Builds harness assemblies.
* Light usage of computers to monitor and report job status and component availability. Will need to be able to open prints or work instructions from system and write to excel or SAP databases.
* May perform thru-hole PCB assembly.
* Performs related duties as assigned by Supervisor.
* Works overtime as required.
* Strives to meet prescribed quality standards in an ISO environment.
* Follows proper use of PPE’s to promote a safe work environment and performs 5S steps to ensure clean, hazard-free, and efficient work area.


**What will help you thrive in this role?**
-------------------------------------------


* Minimum of 1-3 years electro-mechanical assembly experience. Mechanical assembly with electronic/electrical safety knowledge is acceptable.
* Ability to read blueprints and schematics; read and identify proper components and color schemes.
* Must present excellent workmanship standards.
* Must have good verbal communication skills.


**Competencies**
----------------


Builds Talent**Hubbell Incorporated**  


Hubbell creates critical infrastructure solutions that power our customers, communities, people and the planet. Our company is strategically aligned around enabling grid modernization and electrification. As more products plug in to an aging grid, Hubbell solutions enable the transition to a more reliable, resilient and efficient energy infrastructure. Founded in 1888 our innovation has made us a leading global manufacturer of high quality electrical and utility solutions enabling customers to operate critical infrastructure reliably and efficiently.  


The company operates in two segments. Hubbell Utility Solutions (HUS) enable the grid to conduct, communicate and control energy across utility applications and Hubbell Electrical Solutions (HES) are essential to managing power across a wide range of industries and applications. Our vertical market solutions can be applied to markets including Data Centers, Renewables, Commercial Buildings, Industrial, Telecom and Transportation. Supporting both of our business segments is our corporate and Hubbell Unified Business Solutions teams that provide consistent process, tools technologies across our businesses.  


We are committed to operating sustainably and ethically while promoting an inclusive and supportive culture for our people to grow and develop in their careers. Our employees proudly work and serve our communities from our headquarters in Shelton, CT, across the United States and around the globe.  


**Hubbell Utility Solutions**  


Hubbell Utility Solutions (HUS) enable the grid to conduct, communicate and control energy across utility applications. HUS provides the critical components that allow the grid to reliably transmit and distribute energy, as well as the communications and controls technologies to make the grid smarter and more flexible.  


Hubbell Incorporated, its subsidiaries and affiliates, is an EO Employer AA: M/F/Veteran/Disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other protected class.

title: Quality Control Technician
description:
**Job Summary**

The Quality Control Technician is directly responsible for supporting Onkos Manufacturing and Onkos Quality Control. Direct responsibilities will include component inspection, data collection, inspection plan generation, CMM programming, CMM inspection, optical comparator and data trending. Additionally, this role (as needed) will site visit manufacturing facilities within the Onkos Supply Chain to ensure new processes are compliant, inspection methodologies are consistent with Onkos Standards and root cause analysis as they relate to non-conforming product, are initiated, completed, and approved within a timely manner. Lastly, the Quality Control Technician will collaborate with team members in areas of process improvements, kaizen initiatives and reducing the cost of poor quality.

**Responsibilities**

* Developing and implementing quality inspection plans.
* Monitoring and analyzing quality performance of internal and external supply chain.
* Component Inspection, data collection, data trending and root cause analysis.
* CMM Programming and component inspection.
* ISO Class #8 cleanroom compliance requirements.
* ISO Class #8 component inspection & assembly inspection.
* Collaborating with team members to develop and implement improvements to reduce the cost of poor quality.
* Risk mitigation and counter measures.
* Ensuring that workflows, processes, and products comply with quality and safety regulations.
* Investigating and troubleshooting product or production issues.
* Developing corrective actions, solutions, and improvements.
* Other responsibilities as assigned.

**Requirements**

* Associates Degree in mechanical engineering, trade school or equivalent.
* 7-10 years of experience in quality inspection in a manufacturing environment.
* Experience with Comparators, Coordinate Measurement Machines, Gaging, Data Collection and Key Performance Indicator reporting.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent project management skills.
* Must excel in a fast-paced environment.
* Adhere to Onkos Core Beliefs, Code of Business Conduct, all regulatory requirements, and quality standards.
* Support company advocacy initiatives to help raise awareness of sarcoma and pediatric cancer and drive positive change that will impact the lives of cancer patients.
* Travel requirement: Up to 10%.

**About Onkos**

At Onkos Surgical, we believe individuals with cancer requiring surgery deserve solutions designed specifically for them. These individuals, their caregivers and their support network deserve an organization passionately championing their cause.

At Onkos Surgical, we exist to maintain a singular focus on surgical oncology by looking at everything we do through the lens of the cancer surgeon and their patients.

At Onkos Surgical, we will:

* Find solutions to our patients’ unmet clinical needs and advocate for their cause.
* Partner with surgical oncologists through research, education and innovation, to treat their patients more effectively and more efficiently.
* Collaborate with regulatory agencies to find pathways to provide timely solutions while upholding the highest standards of quality or compliance.
* Fulfill our employees’ desire to make a difference in the lives of the patients they serve while achieving their own professional growth.
* Deliver value to our customers and shareholders.

title: CAD Technician
description:
Our client, Mueser Rutledge Consulting Engineers (MRCE),is looking to hire a talented CAD technician to generate surface and solid CAD models for our clients. You will be responsible for meeting with draftsmen, engineers or architects and transforming client blueprints and design plans into computer generated models using CAD software. You may be required to work as part of a team or individually on a project.

To ensure success as a CAD technician, you should have extensive working experience with CAD software, a keen eye for detail, and the ability to work as part of a team. A top-class CAD technician is a technical wizard, creating exact computer models of building and machine designs according to the client’s specifications.

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

Prepare detailed drawings of architectural and structural features of buildings or drawings and topographical relief maps used in civil engineering projects, such as highways, bridges, and public works. Use knowledge of building materials, engineering practices, and mathematics to complete drawings.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Meeting with engineers, draftsmen, and designers to review blueprints and design drawings.
* Input design specifications into the CAD software.
* Creating surface and solid CAD models according to client specifications.
* Produce drawings, using computer-assisted drafting systems (CAD) or drafting machines, or by hand, using compasses, dividers, protractors, triangles, and other drafting devices.
* Draft plans and detailed drawings for structures, installations, and construction projects, such as highways, sewage disposal systems, and dikes, working from sketches or notes.
* Analyze building codes, by-laws, space and site requirements, and other technical documents and reports to determine their effect on architectural designs.
* Draw maps, diagrams, and profiles, using cross-sections and surveys, to represent elevations, topographical contours, subsurface formations, and structures.
* Lay out and plan interior room arrangements for commercial buildings, using computer-assisted drafting (CAD) equipment and software.
* Finish and duplicate drawings and documentation packages according to required mediums and specifications for reproduction, using blueprinting, photography, or other duplicating methods.
* Draw rough and detailed scale plans for foundations, buildings, and structures, based on preliminary concepts, sketches, engineering calculations, specification sheets, and other data.
* Correlate, interpret, and modify data obtained from topographical surveys, well logs, and geophysical prospecting reports.
* Supervise or conduct field surveys, inspections, or technical investigations to obtain data required to revise construction drawings.
* Obtain and assemble data to complete architectural designs, visiting job sites to compile measurements as necessary.
* Determine quality, cost, strength, and quantity of required materials, and enter figures on materials lists.
* Locate and identify symbols on topographical surveys to denote geological and geophysical formations or oil field installations.
* Create freehand drawings and lettering to accompany drawings.
* Calculate excavation tonnage and prepare graphs and fill-hauling diagrams for use in earth-moving operations.
* Calculate weights, volumes, and stress factors and their implications for technical aspects of designs.
* Plot characteristics of boreholes for oil and gas wells from photographic subsurface survey recordings and other data, representing depth, degree, and direction of inclination.
* Prepare cost estimates, contracts, bidding documents, and technical reports for specific projects under an architect's or engineer's supervision.
* Represent architect or engineer on construction site, ensuring builder compliance with design specifications and advising on design corrections, under supervision.

**REQUIRED AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

*What is needed to be hired.*  
**Education:**

* Minimum two-year technical degree, preferred bachelor’s degree in engineering or design
* Applied Science in Drafting & Design

**Required Skills:**

* CAD Technician with basic training in the use of Autodesk AutoCAD software. Some experience in structural detailing, such as, concrete reinforcing, steel connections, and timber work a plus. Knowledge of support of excavation, underpinning, and wall bracing a plus.
* Knowledge and efficient use of AutoCAD software required. Ability to use AutoCAD for drawing file publishing, sheet sets, page setups, Xrefs, text attributes, and layout viewports required.
* Knowledge of Metric and English systems required. Knowledge of 3D environment required. Autodesk certification a plus. Knowledge of Bentley MicroStation a plus.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work required by individuals accepting employment for this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required. MRCE has authority to change or assign other duties to the Instrumentation Engineer role.

MRCE *is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, pregnancy, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, service in the uniformed services, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.*

title: Corporate Concierge
description:
**Company Overview**

Diamond Properties is a commercial real estate owner and operator headquartered in Mount Kisco, NY. Our portfolio primarily focuses on industrial sites and includes over 90 properties totaling 16 million square feet across 12 states. Since our founding in 1995, we have followed a long-term buy-and-improve strategy that, when combined with quality-driven customer service, has enabled us to deliver consistently high tenant satisfaction and lease renewal rates. Learn more about Diamond Properties and our portfolio at www.dpmgt.com.

**Position Overview:**  
As a Corporate Concierge at Diamond Properties, you will serve as the primary point of contact for tenants and visitors while also ensuring smooth transitions for new and departing members. Your role is pivotal in fostering a welcoming and efficient environment, upholding the highest standards of service and satisfaction.

**Responsibilities:**

**Front Desk Operations:**

* Warmly and professionally greet tenants and visitors.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the front desk area.

**Tenant and Visitor Assistance:**

* Provide information on building amenities, services, and local attractions.
* Handle inquiries and requests promptly and courteously.

**Event Coordination:**

* Assist in planning and coordinating building events, including tenant meetings and social gatherings.
* Distribute necessary information to promote events and ensure operational requirements are met.

**Security and Access Control:**

* Monitor building access and enforce security protocols.
* Track and manage keycard inventory, coordinating with relevant teams as needed.

**Administrative Support:**

* Assist with mail distribution, package handling, and data entry.
* Maintain accurate records and databases related to tenant information and service requests.

**Move-In & Move-Out Support: (Office Tenants, Velocity, and Safe Haven)**

* Conduct pre-move-in meetings with new accounts, providing necessary information and materials.
* Manage onboarding materials and maintain the tenant membership IT portal.
* Coordinate move-in and move-out processes, including scheduling and communication.

**Sales Support: (Safe Haven and Velocity)** 

* Conduct tours for prospective members as scheduled by the sales team.
* Assist in sales hand-offs and manage member communications regarding move-out requests or other inquiries.

**Building Operations and Management:**

* Conduct morning walkthroughs to address any issues and escalate recurring problems.
* Educate tenants on building policies and procedures and communicate building updates.
* Liaise with cleaning companies to maintain building standards and organize key distribution.

**Safety and Security:**

* Review and understand emergency action plans and respond appropriately to incidents.
* Create incident reports as necessary and follow instructions from leadership during emergencies.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in hospitality, customer service, or a related field preferred.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
* Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks effectively, and adapt to changing situations.
* Knowledge of local area attractions and flexibility to work evenings or weekends as needed.

At Diamond Properties, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and welcoming environment for all employees and visitors. Join our team and contribute to delivering exceptional service and hospitality in one of Stamford's premier buildings.

**AAP/EEO Statement:** Diamond Properties is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information. This policy applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment, including recruitment, hiring, placement, compensation, promotion, discipline and termination.

title: Pipefitter Lead
description:
**\\*This job is a civilian position and does not require military service (including commission and enlistment)**

***Join one of the Navy's largest Commands as a Civilian to Maximize Naval Shore Readiness and Strengthen our Team! We offer competitive benefits, retirement package, paid leave, and other exciting opportunities!*** 

**You will serve as a PIPEFITTER LEADER in the UTILITIES & ENERGY BRANCH of NAVFAC ENGINEERING CMD MID-ATLANTIC located in Colts Neck, New Jersey**

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***

* **Immediate access to Healthcare /Full Benefits Package!**
* **Work-Life Balance**
* **401K (with 5% matching)**
* **Pension Plan**
* **All Federal Holidays off, Sick Leave, and Annual Leave**
* **Tuition Discounts**
* **Alternate Work Schedules**
* **Employee assistance program**
* **Life insurance**
* **Flexible spending account**

***\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\**** **DUTIES*****\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\****

* You will analyze scheduling data to determine necessary corrective actions that will improve maintenance schedule performance.
* You will develop overall shop practices for assigned pipefitting-oriented production operations.
* You will direct development or formulation of work activities which support goals and objectives related to multi-trade production operations.
* You will layout and plan the needed routing, placement, pitch, incline, and elevations of piping systems and equipment to achieve optimal results.
* You will operate power tools (e.g., pipe threaders, pipe cutters, pipe bending machines, power augers) to accomplish pipefitting tasks.

***\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\****

**QUALIFICATIONS**

1) Install, modify, and repair new and existing high-pressure piping systems and equipment such as, steam-heating, steam generation, and hydraulic systems, steam generators, flash and expansion tanks, condensate, vacuum systems, radiators and circulating pumps;

2) Plan and lay out the installation, modification, and repair of various new and existing piping systems and equipment;

3) Uses tools and equipment such as sliding squares, measuring tapes, dividers, chalk lines, plumb bobs, templates, star drills, grinders, flanges, hand and power pipe threaders and cutters, and pipe wrenches; and

4) Motivate and lead other workers in accomplishing the work of the unit, and to communicate effectively to brief the supervisor and pass on instructions and work methods and procedures to the team.

**NOTE: This information must be supported in your résumé to be considered for the position (chronological format).**

Applicants must meet the requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Job Qualification Handbook for Trades and Labor Occupations. Additional qualification information can be found at: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/federal-wage-system-qualifications/#url=WG-2800

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***

**https://atlantic.navfac.navy.mil/NAVFAC-Worldwide/NAVFAC-Mid-Atlantic/Careers/**

**www.facebook.com/navfacmidatlantic**

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***

**CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT**

* **Requires U.S. Citizenship for Work Authorization.**
* Must be determined suitable for federal employment.
* Must participate in the direct deposit pay program.
* New employees to the Department of the Navy will be required to successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
* Within the Department of Defense (DoD), the appointment of retired military members within 180 days immediately following retirement date to a civilian position is subject to the provisions of 5 United States Code 3326.
* Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service.
* This is a bargaining unit position.
* You will be required to obtain and maintain a current valid United States driver's license.
* You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.
* You will be required to wear personal protective equipment such as helmets, gloves, coveralls, glasses, goggles, respirators and safety shoes continuously for the duration of the work shift.
* This is a Mission Essential position. You will be required to ensure organization or facility continuity of operations and/or completion of tasks that are considered essential to the mission designated by a local or command decision.
* This position is subject to work an uncommon tour, including nights, weekends, and holidays to meet mission requirements. Overtime or night differential pay and/or unusual duty hours may be required. Management Discretion
* This position requires a physical before onboarding and annually thereafter.
* May be required to serve on-call duty on a rotational basis. When on-call, incumbent is required to carry a duty cell phone and duty pager and must remain available to respond on site to after-hour emergencies within two hours.
* The incumbent serving in this position may at any time be reassigned to a similar position at any site or workstation within the commuting area as a condition of employment.
* You will be required to complete training, obtain, and maintain a government credit card for travel and travel-related purchases

*The Department of Navy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, or any other non-merit factor.*

title: Learning Zone Teacher
description:
**Essential Function**

The After-School Teacher supports the After-School Program Director by helping to create a caring and safe environment for the children and assisting in activities to improve the overall care and quality of education. S/he must be able to communicate, listen and work well with others in a team environment, assisting the staff in implementing a quality school-age educational program and developing positive relationships with the children and their parents. The After-School Teacher observes and documents children’s interests and progress, relays that information back to parents and staff, and implements developmentally appropriate activities under the direction of the Program Director.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

*The duties listed below are the primary duties of this position but are not all the required duties. The Salvation Army reserves the right to change, reduce or expand the duties of this position at any time. Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this role.*

* Develop and implement school-age program activities and curriculum and encourage children’s participation.
* Establish a safe, healthy, and comfortable environment for all students.
* Actively engage in activities, managing classroom materials' cleanliness, order, and availability.
* Maintain frequent communications with parents through informal discussions and daily reports.
* Encourage self-help and good hygiene through behavior modeling.
* Help ensure smooth, daily transitions for children.
* Follow all program policies and state regulations.
* Maintain a clean and organized work environment.
* Utilize classroom assessment and evaluation tools for child development and curriculum.
* Communicate accidents, sicknesses, and incidents to the Program Director promptly.
* Complete and maintain professional development to ensure continuous quality improvement.
* Other duties within the scope of the role as assigned by the supervisors.

**Requirements**

* Infant/Child and Adult CPR/First Aid certification; must be willing to get certified within the first 90 days.
* Must undergo and pass a criminal background check and additional screening required by the licensing body.
* Must be willing to support and lead faith-based kids’ activities and programming.
* Must provide health screening that includes physical and TB results within the first 90 days.
* Must understand and support the mission of The Salvation Army.

**Desired Qualifications**

* Minimum of two (2) years of professional education experience or classroom teaching experience preferred.
* Foundational understanding of child development.
* Strong technological proficiency in O365 (Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to work well with others (staff, children, and parents) and to foster a team environment.
* Proven leadership, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Bilingual English/Spanish strongly preferred.
